intro: Helianthus mollis, commonly known as the softhead sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its hairy, soft leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 2 to 4 feet and prefers full sun and well-drained soil. Its scientific name, Helianthus mollis, reflects its soft foliage and its classification within the sunflower genus. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
